instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Fin Stack Sensor Error fixed?
threads.message: Ok so this 2012 definitely had liquid the board was very clean when I got it but the underside of the lid was HORRENDOUS lmfao. Anyways, the sensor that failed was the fin stack sensor, so I replaced <CHIP>U5511</CHIP> and checked the caps and resistors on the circuit for shorts or damage and they all check out. I ran ASD again and was STILL getting crazy high fan speed, so I replaced <RESISTOR>R5260</RESISTOR> and <RESISTOR>R5261</RESISTOR> because they were reading 1/4 of their values. Still had high fan speed, so I removed the edge bonding from the SMC and reflowed it. Now the fan speed is completely gone BUT the board still fails the Fin Stack sensor test. The machine boots normally and runs off a battery, and even on a slow old, spindle drive it runs pretty well. I'm going to test it with a known good drive tomorrow just to make sure it is running full speed like it should, but my question is should I keep looking at the sensor failure even if the machine is running properly?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Fin Stack Sensor Error fixed?
threads.message: Look at the actual reported temperature in the ASD hardware profile.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Fin Stack Sensor Error fixed?
threads.message: Sensor says -124 degrees BUT with a known good drive, it runs perfectly fine and boots normally haven't seen it crash once nor have any issues. Should I just leave this alone?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Fin Stack Sensor Error fixed?
threads.message: It means the sensing transistor <TRANSISTOR>Q5520</TRANSISTOR> is not connected or shorted to <CHIP>U5511</CHIP>. Check traces, <TRANSISTOR>Q5520</TRANSISTOR> and <CAPACITOR>C5511</CAPACITOR>

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Fin Stack Sensor Error fixed?
